body_html:
@jaros3
I believe this is because the build_pip_package.sh script failed to recognize your platform as Windows. It shouldn't reach the cp command at all.
See

tensorflow/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.sh

Lines 67 to 72 in 4dcfddc

if is_windows; then
rm -rf ./bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/simple_console_for_window_unzip
mkdir -p ./bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/simple_console_for_window_unzip
echo "Unzipping simple_console_for_windows.zip to create runfiles tree..."
unzip -o -q ./bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/simple_console_for_windows.zip -d ./bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/simple_console_for_window_unzip
echo "Unzip finished."

Which bash are you using? I guess the PLATFORM env wasn't msys_nt? We should fix this is_windows function.

I believe this is because the build_pip_package.sh script failed to recognize your platform as Windows. It shouldn't reach the cp command at all.
See

             echo "Unzip finished." 
        
    
  


Which bash are you using? I guess the PLATFORM env wasn't msys_nt? We should fix this is_windows function.
body:
@jaros3 
I believe this is because the `build_pip_package.sh` script failed to recognize your platform as Windows. It shouldn't reach the cp command at all.
See

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/4dcfddc5d12018a5a0fdca652b9221ed95e9eb23/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.sh#L67-L72

Which bash are you using? I guess the `PLATFORM` env wasn't `msys_nt`? We should fix this `is_windows` function.
